title: PHPip2long()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPip2long()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content: Example Convert an IPv4 address into a long integer: "; $out .= "https://www..com/, https://" . $ip . "/, and https://" . sprintf("%u", ip2long($ip)) . "/"; echo $out; ?> Definition and Usage The ip2long() function converts an IPv4 address into a long integer. Syntax ip2long( address ) Parameter Values Parameter Description address Required. Specifies a standard IP address Technical Details Return Value: A long integer. FALSE on failure PHP Version: 4.0+ PHP Changelog: PHP 5.5: Before this version, on Windows, this function might return a valid number even if the passed value was not an IPv4 address. PHP 5.2: PHP 5.5: Before this version, this function might return a valid number even if the passed value was not an IPv4 address. ★ +1

summary: This tutorial covers PHPip2long()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPip2long()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPip2long()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
